item.title: COSMIC DE: February Discussions
item.description: Initial designs for COSMIC DE's text editor are here! COSMIC DE is System76's Rust-based desktop environment currently in development for Pop!_OS.
item.content:encoded: Initial designs for COSMIC DE's text editor are here! COSMIC DE is System76's Rust-based desktop environment currently in development for Pop!_OS. https://blog.system76.com/post/cosmic-de-february-discussions

item.title: More On COSMIC DE To Kick Off 2023!
item.description: Alex shares more progress on the work-in-progress COSMIC DE for Pop!_OS. This one’s got new mockups for you to poke around in!
item.content:encoded: Alex shares more progress on the work-in-progress COSMIC DE for Pop!_OS. This one’s got new mockups for you to poke around in! https://blog.system76.com/post/more-on-cosmic-de-to-kick-off-2023

item.title: 2022 at System76: A Year in Review
item.description: It’s that time of year again…to end it! In preparation for the New Year, we’re taking a look back at the milestones we reached in 2022.
item.content:encoded: It’s that time of year again…to end it! In preparation for the New Year, we’re taking a look back at the milestones we reached in 2022. https://blog.system76.com/post/2022-at-system76-a-year-in-review

item.title: November at System76: Products, Promos, & COSMIC DE
item.description: After last week’s feast and many, many leftovers, we’re serving up a summary of all the juicy morsels we’ve encountered this month here at System76. Bon appétit!
item.content:encoded: After last week’s feast and many, many leftovers, we’re serving up a summary of all the juicy morsels we’ve encountered this month here at System76. Bon appétit! https://blog.system76.com/post/november-at-system76-products-promos--cosmic-de

item.title: SpoOoOoOky Update: Murmurin’s of a Pop!_OS October
item.description: ‘Twas a dark n stormy night. The developers were clackin’ at their keyboards, sweat oozing from their brow. Yaargh.
item.content:encoded: ‘Twas a dark n stormy night. The developers were clackin’ at their keyboards, sweat oozing from their brow. Yaargh. https://blog.system76.com/post/spooooooky-update-murmurins-of-a-pop_os-october

item.title: Celebrating 5 Years of Pop!_OS
item.description: Five years. Can you believe it? To celebrate, we’re looking back at where Pop!_OS started, how it’s grown, and where it’s going next. Thanks for joining us on this journey!
item.content:encoded: Five years. Can you believe it? To celebrate, we’re looking back at where Pop!_OS started, how it’s grown, and where it’s going next. Thanks for joining us on this journey! https://blog.system76.com/post/celebrating-5-years-of-pop_os

item.title: Pop!_OS 22.04 LTS has landed!
item.description: Now that those bunny eggs have been painted and the afikomen has been found, it’s time to upgrade Pop!_OS! Here’s what’s new in Pop!_OS 22.04 LTS:
item.content:encoded: Now that those bunny eggs have been painted and the afikomen has been found, it’s time to upgrade Pop!_OS! Here’s what’s new in Pop!_OS 22.04 LTS: https://blog.system76.com/post/popos-2204-lts-has-landed

item.title: Pop!_OS 21.10 has landed!
item.description: Now that the first snowflake has descended gracefully upon our Denver headquarters, it’s time to upgrade to the newest version of Pop!_OS. Here’s what’s new in Pop!_OS 21.10:
item.content:encoded: Now that the first snowflake has descended gracefully upon our Denver headquarters, it’s time to upgrade to the newest version of Pop!_OS. Here’s what’s new in Pop!_OS 21.10: https://blog.system76.com/post/popos-2110-has-landed

item.title: Open Up: Contributions and Collaborations
item.description: Hello fellow space travelers! It’s been a while since we catalogued all of our goings on here on Starship Pop!_OS, so we thought it might be a good time to highlight what our upstream contributions have looked like over the last couple of years. We’ve been logging some major light years! Have a look.
item.content:encoded: Hello fellow space travelers! It’s been a while since we catalogued all of our goings on here on Starship Pop!_OS, so we thought it might be a good time to highlight what our upstream contributions have looked like over the last couple of years. We’ve been logging some major light years! Have a look. https://blog.system76.com/post/open-up-contributions-and-collaborations

item.title: Robert Bunn is developing an AI to prevent preterm births
item.description: As part of System76’s Unleash Your Potential Program, AI researcher Robert Bunn has been using the Oryx Pro to develop artificial intelligence to predict and prevent preterm births.
item.content:encoded: As part of System76’s Unleash Your Potential Program, AI researcher Robert Bunn has been using the Oryx Pro to develop artificial intelligence to predict and prevent preterm births. https://blog.system76.com/post/robert-bunn-is-developing-an-ai-to-prevent-preterm
